This is the default anti-aliased hinting algorithm
A lighter anti-aliased hinting algorithm\nMany generated glyphs are more fuzzy but better resemble its original shape
Strong hinting algorithm that should only be used for monochrome output
Disable hinting\nThis disables the font's native hinter and the auto-hinter
Disable the auto-hinter and prefer the font's native hinter if it has one\nThis overrides 'Prefer Auto-hinter'
Prefer using the auto-hinter over the font's native hinter\nThis is overridden by 'Disable Auto-hinter' and 'Disable Hinting'
Keep glyphs in font units and ignore requested size\nThis implies 'Disable Hinting'
Slightly warp glyphs to improve their grid alignment\nThis requires the auto-hinter and 'Normal' hinting mode
This interpreter is based on the TrueType specification and produces black-and-white bitmaps

Tile Horizontally and Tile Vertically relate to how the edges of the image will be\ncreated when placed on the texture page. An image that is to be tiled will have the edges (horizontal or vertical)\nadded to by the edges from the opposite side.

10 digit alpha-numeric identifier taken from your developer.apple.com/#/overview URL. If blank this will inherit the value set in Platform Options

To distribute your title outside of the Mac App Store macOS requires that your
package is codesigned. Please provide the signing identity that you wish to use
here: this should be a Developer ID Application identity and should be present
in your Mac's login keychain certificates. Signing identities can be easily created
in Xcode->Preferences->Accounts->Team->View Details->Developer ID
Application->Create. Signing identities will be matched so the default value
should be sufficient if you are only the member of one development team.

Returns the number of active instances of the object.
Creates an instance of an object.
Change an instance to be an instance of another object.
Destroy an instance and remove it from the room.
Destroy all instances at a position.
Change the sprite of an object instance.
Set the rotation of an instance.
Set the animation speed of an instance's sprite.
Set the horizontal and vertical scaling of an instance's sprite.
Set the transparency (0-1) of an instance's sprite.
Set the colour blend of an instance's sprite.

Get the countdown value of an alarm event.
Call this event on the instance's parent object.
Check if a mouse button is pressed.
Check if a mouse button is held or released.
Check if a mouse button is released.
Check if a key is pressed.
Check if a key is down or released.
Check if a key is released.
Get the value of an axis on a gamepad.
Get the value of a gamepad's trigger button.
Check if a gamepad button is down or released.
Check if a gamepad button is pressed.
Check if a gamepad button is released.
Set the deadzone of a gamepad axis.
Set the threshold for the analogue buttons of the given gamepad device.
Get the number of connected gamepad devices.
Get whether a given gamepad is connected.
Set a direction towards a specified point.
Set a random direction based on the specified directions.
Set the speed of an instance.

Hide the virtual keyboard. Once the keyboard is hidden, a System event of type "keyboard status" is raised.
Check if the virtual keyboard is showing. If querying the status, a System event of type "keyboard status" is raised.
Get the current pixel height of the virtual keyboard if it is visible.
Reverse a direction from a list of presets.
Apply friction to the instance's movement.
Jump to the instance's start position.
Snap an instance's position to a grid.
Check if an instance overlaps any object instances at a position.
Check if an instance overlaps one or more instances of a specific object at a position.
Check if one or more instances intersect a shape.
Check if one or more instances intersect a point.
Draw the specified value. It can be a string, number or variable.
Draw a value with a transformation. It can be a string, number or variable.
Draw a sprite multiple times in a stack.
Draw a gradient in a rectangular shape.
Draw a gradient in an elliptical shape.
Draw a healthbar from a 0-100 value.
Draw an instance's score with a caption.
Draw an instance's health with a healthbar.
Draw an instance's lives with stacked sprites.
Set the colour to blend all drawing with.
Get the colour used to blend all drawing with.
Get the font used for all text drawing.
Get the horizontal or vertical alignment of text drawing.
Set the font to use for all text drawing.
Set the horizontal and vertical alignment of text drawing.

Get the tile index at the specified position.

Get the tile index in the specified cell.

Set the tile data at the specified position on a tile layer.

Set the tile set resource of a tilemap.
Apply a transformation to tile data.
Get the transformation of tile data.

Get the score of the instance.

Get the life count of the instance.
Set the health variable of the instance.
Get the health of the instance.
Create a new random seed used by the random number generator.
Repeat code a number of times.
Execute code while a given expression is true.
Switch which branch to execute based on input.
A branch to execute in a switch if the case is true.
Round a decimal value to an integer value by rounding, ceiling or flooring it.
Convert a string to a number.
Convert a number to a string.
A self-contained loop structure with initialise, condition and increment statements.

Get a variable pertaining to a room view.
Create a new grid data structure.
Check if a data structure exists.

Please note that these are early release builds. This means that they may have bugs that could corrupt your projects. We strongly recommend that you back up your project using source control and use a separate copy of it when using a beta build.
If you do not back up your project and it is corrupted by a beta build there may be no way to recover it.
You can revert back to a non-beta build by clicking the button below.

A fatal exception has occurred in GameMaker Studio 2 and the program needs to close.\n\nWe are sorry for the inconvenience.
Please tell us about this problem.

An error report has been created so that we can examine and prevent issues like this. It would be very helpful if you could provide further details relating to the context of this event. Specifically, what you were working on immediately beforehand.
